sub.title: Adult Dosing
sub.mono:
• Plaque psoriasis, Moderate to severe, in candidates for phototherapy or systemic therapy: Initial titration over 5 days: Day 1, 10 mg ORALLY in AM; Day 2, 10 mg ORALLY twice daily; Day 3, 10 mg in AM, 20 mg in PM; Day 4, 20 mg ORALLY twice daily; Day 5, 20 mg in AM, 30 mg in PM; do not crush, split, or chew
  • Plaque psoriasis, Moderate to severe, in candidates for phototherapy or systemic therapy: Maintenance: Day 6 and thereafter, 30 mg ORALLY twice daily; do not crush, split, or chew
  • Psoriatic arthritis, Active: Initial titration over 5 days: Day 1, 10 mg ORALLY in AM; Day 2, 10 mg ORALLY twice daily; Day 3, 10 mg in AM, 20 mg in PM; Day 4, 20 mg ORALLY twice daily; Day 5, 20 mg in AM, 30 mg in PM; do not crush, split, or chew
  • Psoriatic arthritis, Active: Maintenance: Day 6 and thereafter, 30 mg ORALLY twice daily; do not crush, split, or chew

sub.title: Pediatric Dosing
sub.mono: safety and efficacy not established in pediatric patients

sub.title: Dose Adjustments
sub.mono:
• renal impairment, severe (estimated CrCl less than 30 mL/min by the Cockroft-Gault equation): initiate dose with 10 mg ORALLY once daily for 3 days, 20 mg ORALLY once daily on days 4 and 5, and then 30 mg ORALLY once daily on day 6 and thereafter
  • hepatic impairment: no dosage adjustments needed

sub.title: Indications
sub.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
  • Plaque psoriasis, Moderate to severe, in candidates for phototherapy or systemic therapy
  • Psoriatic arthritis, Active

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: hypersensitivity to apremilast or any component of the product

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• coadministration with strong CYP450 inducers; use is not recommended
  • depression has been reported during therapy; increased risk with history of depression, suicidality, or both; consider discontinuation if symptoms occur
  • renal impairment, severe (estimated CrCl 0 to 30 mL/min by the Cockroft-Gault equation); dose reduction required
  • weight loss, clinically significant, has been reported; monitoring recommended; treatment discontinuation may be required
  • suspected adverse reactions; report to US Food and Drug Administration at 1-800-FDA-1088, or www.fda.gov/medwatch

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Gastrointestinal:Diarrhea (Psoriasis, 17%; psoriatic arthritis, 7.7% to 9.3%), Nausea (Psoriasis, 17%; psoriatic arthritis, 7.4% to 8.9%)
  • Neurologic:Headache (4.8% to 6%), Tension-type headache (Psoriasis, 8%)
Serious
  • Endocrine metabolic:Weight decreased (10% to 12%)
  • Psychiatric:Depression (1% to 1.3%), Suicidal behavior, Suicidal thoughts

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Apremilast, is a phosphodiesterase 4 (PDE4) inhibitor, with specificity for cyclic adenosine monophosphate (cAMP) that results in increased intracellular cAMP levels. The exact mechanism in psoriatic arthritis is not well defined.

sub.title: Absorption
sub.mono:
• Bioavailability, Oral: 73%
  • Tmax, Oral: 2.5 hours
  • Effects of food: no effect on absorption

sub.title: Metabolism
sub.mono:
• Metabolite M12: inactive, plus up to 23 metabolites identified in the plasma, urine, and feces
  • Substrate of CYP3A4, CYP1A2, CYP2A6, and P-glycoprotein

sub.title: Excretion
sub.mono:
• Renal excretion: 3% unchanged
  • Fecal excretion: 7% unchanged
  • Total body clearance: 10 L/hr

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Oral
  • may administer without regard to food
  • do not crush, split, or chew tablets

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• symptomatic improvement of psoriatic arthritis is indicative of efficacy
  • patient weight; during treatment

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Tell patient to report any unintentional weight loss
  • Side effects may include headache, diarrhea, or nausea.
  • Instruct patient to report worsening depression, suicidal ideation, or unusual changes in behavior.
